intro: Lobogyne papuana, commonly known as the Papuan lobogyne, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
